image.altText: A statue of a man and a donkey suspended in the air outside the Australian War Memorial.

props.synopsis: It's hoped visitors will now be more easily able to interact with the sculpture, and even pat the donkey.

title.children: Iconic sculpture returns to Australian War Memorial for visitors to pat

image.altText: A middle-aged Sri Lankan woman in glasses speaks into a microphone, with a sign reading 'Sri Lanka'

props.synopsis: The worker was paid $11,212 for roughly three years of work as a domestic worker at the Sri Lankan High Commissioner's residence in Canberra.

title.children: Domestic worker who was paid about 90c daily by Sri Lankan diplomat is awarded $117,000

image.altText: Bucket of brown, murky water sitting under an outdoor tap. It looks disgusting.

props.synopsis: The last upgrade of the Yass Valley's water treatment plant was in 1990, with residents dealing with ongoing issues with the quality of their water.

title.children: Water upgrades coming for region where most won't drink from the tap

image.altText: A museum exhibit with projections on the wall and artefacts in the middle.

props.synopsis: The Pompeii exhibition at the National Museum uses immersive audiovisual elements alongside artefacts to show attendees what life may have been like.

title.children: Exhibition shows Pompeii before and after volcano erupts

image.altText: A apartment building with cars driving on a main road in the foreground.

props.synopsis: CoreLogic data for 2024 shows house prices in Canberra are the third highest in the country, behind Sydney and Brisbane, and continue to track upwards. Â

title.children: The ACT's priciest and cheapest suburbs, according to CoreLogic

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walking into court.

props.synopsis: An indictment alleging Bruce Lehrmann raped a woman in Queensland in October 2021 has been presented to the Toowoomba District Court.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann alleged rape indictments presented to court

image.altText: Two people walk down the entrance to an inland waterway with a sign reading "Area closed for primary contact".

props.synopsis: Because of elevated bacteria levels, four sites at Lake Burley Griffin are closed for swimming, along with Cotter Avenue, Kambah Pool, Pine Island and Point Hut Crossing.

title.children: Most ACT waterways closed for swimming due to elevated bacteria

image.altText: Two unidentified people sit at a desk with several boxes labelled MS-2 Step. One wears doctor's lab coat

props.synopsis: Family Planning Australia has analysed data on medical terminations across NSW, highlighting how access to abortion remains a postcode lottery.

title.children: Family Planning report reveals abortion deserts across regional NSW

image.altText: People wave the flag of the Syrian rebels.

props.synopsis: The collapse of the Assad regime has fragmented Syria's territory, with several armed groups now jostling for control and international players anxious to preserve their regional interests.

title.children: Syria in a map: Who controls what now that Assad is gone?

image.altText: Children and women gather around the remnants of a burnt out truck.

props.synopsis: Pakistan's government denies the shooting deaths reported by ousted leader Imran Khan's party, while journalists on the ground reveal the roadblocks they've faced trying to uncover the true death toll.

title.children: As Imran Khan mourns, Pakistan government denies protest deaths

image.altText: A woman sits in front of a laptop

props.synopsis: A Queensland call centre, currently under investigation by ASIC, has been put into voluntary liquidation. The company denies any wrongdoing.

title.children: 'Super detectives' under investigation by ASIC put into voluntary liquidation

image.altText: The PNG Orchids celebrate a try against Fetu Samoa.

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea is set to enter the NRL in 2028, but the Australian Rugby League Commission will not put a timeline on when a women's team will be established.

title.children: 'We want to make sure they're competitive': PNG NRLW team put on hold

image.altText: CCTV screenshots of a man walking down a street with a white and black zip up jumper on

props.synopsis: Police allege a 35-year-old man broke into a nursing home on the NSW Central Coast last year and assaulted the woman, who died in hospital two weeks later.

title.children: Murder charge for man accused of sexually assaulting woman in her 90s

props.synopsis: The annual awards ceremony celebrates the year and looks forward to what is coming next in video games. Follow live.Â

title.children: Astro Bot wins Game of the Year at 2024 Game Awards

image.altText: A man is silhouetted against a video screen with an Facebook logo as he poses with a smartphone

props.synopsis: The nine-month delay to respond to Meta's refusal to continue paying for news cost Australian media hundreds of jobs, the Coalition says, urging the government not to delay any further with its tax on social media giants.

title.children: News companies have shed hundreds of jobs since Meta's refusal to pay them

image.altText: An older white man in a suit points as he speaks sternly in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden has commuted the sentences of roughly 1,500 Americans who were released from prison and placed in home confinement during the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as pardoning 39 Americans convicted of nonviolent crimes.

title.children: Biden pardons 39, commutes 1,500 sentences in record act of clemency

image.altText: A cover for TIME Magazine, showing Donald Trump in a red frame

props.synopsis:
The president-elect beat out fellow nominees Kamala Harris, Princess Catherine, Joe Rogan, Elon Musk, Benjamin Netanyahu, Mark Zuckerberg, Yulia Navalnaya, Claudia Sheinbaum and Jerome Powell.


Â

title.children: 'I like it better this time': Trump named Time Person of the Year

image.altText: A crowd of rioters waving Trump US flags and banners in front of the Capitol Hill building

props.synopsis: A US Justice Department watchdog has found the FBI had no undercover employees at the scene of the January 6, 2021 Capitol riot and should have done more to gather intelligence on the looming incident.

title.children: US Capitol riot report details FBI missteps before civil unrest

image.altText: A bombed out multi-storey building surrounded by debris in Gaza.

props.synopsis: The latest bloodshed occurred just hours after the UN General Assembly called for an immediate ceasefire in the devastated territory, with Australia supporting the motion but the US and Israel opposing it.

title.children: Guards protecting aid trucks in Gaza killed by Israeli strikes

image.altText: a woman sits on a bench

props.synopsis: Doctors say a health system overhaul is needed to improve the diagnosis and treatment process for ADHD. The federal government says it is supporting the creation of national prescribing rules, an ADHD inquiry recommendation.

title.children: Patients abandon ADHD diagnosis process due to delays, high costs

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has opened lower on Friday after major indices on Wall Street slid ahead of the Federal Reserve's meeting next week. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX down after Wall Street losses, Qantas shares fall during strike

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: RBA keeping an 'open mind' to how economy is evolving

image.altText: A long queue of travellers at Sydney Airport.

props.synopsis: Australian airports are preparing for record-breaking passenger numbers this holiday season, with millions taking to the skies.

title.children: Airports brace for record-breaking passenger numbers

props.synopsis: In celebration of his final day on the News Breakfast couch.Â

title.children: A look back at Michael Rowland's best moments on News Breakfast

image.altText: A man in a suit at a Christmas party holding a glass of champagne and Santa hat while clutching his chest.

props.synopsis: It's the season for parties and celebrating the end of another year, but having a few too many drinks can come with downsides. Some hangover symptoms might even be a sign of a serious heart condition.

title.children: Racing heart after a big night out? You might have more than a hangover

image.altText: The white underside of a male humpback whale's tail, framed in black, seen coming out of blue ocean water

props.synopsis: The whale broke migration records by travelling more than 13,000 kilometres over a period of almost a decade.

title.children: Humpback makes record migration between Pacific and Indian oceans

image.altText: Offensive slurs and graffiti painted on the Victoria Police logo and walls of the Victoria Police memorial at Kings Domain.

props.synopsis: Detectives are investigating offensive slurs painted on the Victoria Police memorial, which is dedicated to those who have died in the line of duty.

title.children: 'Slap in the face' for police as memorial defaced with graffiti

image.altText: An Asian elephant in a crate before moving from Perth to Adelaide.

props.synopsis: One of Perth Zoo's beloved elephants will depart for a new home in South Australia much sooner than originally planned, with keepers now convinced the female should be moved next month.

title.children: Elephant 'in desperate need of company' set for early safari park move

image.altText: A photo of a pair of hands holding a basket with coffee cherries in it.

props.synopsis: Righto then smarty pants, test yourself.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Parcel poaching, coffee prices soaring and a new NRL team for PNG

image.altText: Hand dropping white and purple circles against khaki background.

props.synopsis: The charity sector's most devoted givers won't be around forever. So who will fill the gap?

title.children: Why Australian charities are finding it increasingly hard to raise money

image.altText: A man dressed in papal clothes.

props.synopsis: Covering both film and TV from the past year, Wicked and historical drama ShÅgun have cleaned up in the 2025 Critics Choice award nominations.

title.children: Critics Choice nominations 2025: Conclave and Wicked score 11 nods each

image.altText: GettyImages-50998568

props.synopsis: Police say they have found a body in their search for Tom Voyce, who went missing after his car was swept away in flood waters.

title.children: Body found in search for former England rugby international Voyce

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood juggles a ball during first Test against India.

props.synopsis: Experienced Australia fast bowler Josh Hazlewood will play the third Test against India at the Gabba after overcoming a side strain.

title.children: Hazlewood cleared to return for third Test against India

image.altText: A man in a suit stands next to a man in a black jumper, with blue and yellow Ukrainian flags flying behind them

props.synopsis: No diplomatic staff have been based in Kyiv, Ukraine's war-torn capital, since Russia invaded the country in 2022.

title.children: Australia moves toward reopening embassy in Ukraine

image.altText: A helicopter view of Robert Greig's ute on fire in the middle of a forest.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian father says he now accepts police played no role in the death of his fugitive son in 2022 â with an inquest hearing the theory originated with the operator of a Facebook news page.

title.children: Grieving father now accepts cops didn't kill fugitive son

image.altText: Drone photo of pine tree farm under blue sky

props.synopsis: Converts say there's nothing like the smell of a real Christmas tree, and sustainability and cost concerns are prompting more people to choose them over plastic ones.

title.children: Real Christmas trees in demand as families seek sustainable options
